contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox protected area of Australia | name = Goulburn River National Park | iucn_category = II | image =Goulburn River at Goulburn River Natiional Park.JPG | caption = | map = | map_caption = | locator_x = | locator_y = | location = | nearest_town_or_city = [[Mudgee]] | coordinates ={{Coord|32|14|S|150|00|E|type:landmark_region:AU-NSW|display=inline,title}} | area = 72,296 ha | established = 1983 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | managing_authorities = [[National Parks and Wildlife Service (New South Wales)|NSW National Parks and Wildlife Service]] | official_site = }} '''Goulburn River National Park''' is in [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]], 213 km northwest of [[Sydney]] and it is 35 km south-west of [[Merriwa, New South Wales|Merriwa]]. The Goulburn River National Park is located in the [[Hunter Region|Hunter Valley region]] and covers approximately 90 km of the [[Goulburn River (New South Wales)|Goulburn River]]. It is near the towns of [[Sandy Hollow, New South Wales|Sandy Hollow]], [[Denman, New South Wales|Denman]], [[Merriwa, New South Wales|Merriwa]], and [[Mudgee]]. ==Animals== The park is a sanctuary for kangaroos, wombats, emus, goannas, platypus, and a wide variety of birds. It lies within the [[Mudgee-Wollar Important Bird Area]], so identified by [[BirdLife International]] because of its importance for the [[endangered]] [[Regent Honeyeater]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.birdata.com.au/iba.vm |title=IBA: Mudgee-Wollar |accessdate=2011-08-22 |work= Birdata |first= |last= |publisher=Birds Australia |date= }}</ref> ==See also== * [[Protected areas of New South Wales]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{National Parks of New South Wales}} [[Category:National parks of New South Wales]] [[Category:Upper Hunter Shire]] [[Category:Protected areas established in 1983]] [[Category:1983 establishments in Australia]] [[Category:Important Bird Areas of New South Wales]] {{NewSouthWales-protected-area-stub}} {{UpperHunterShire-geo-stub}}
